0.intro: Welcome to the 4th edition of my DevOps newsletter! You may be wondering why this is issue #0 - I‚Äôve decided to ditch the monthly format in favor of numbered issues instead. And looking around at other tech newsletters, this seems to be the defacto standard. Under this new numerated format, I‚Äôm hoping to publish smaller newsletters, more often.

articles.title: Test title
articles.author: Test Author
articles.description: Example description

1.intro: It‚Äôs been only two weeks since the last issue and there‚Äôs already so much to cover! Besides the usual tech updates, we‚Äôve seen some increased M&A activity and a growing trend of companies doubling-down/going all-in on their remote working cultures. Without a doubt, our industry is currently undergoing a major transformation and I personally can‚Äôt wait to see what type of efficiencies can be enacted with the new societal norms that form.

2.intro: Hi everyone, welcome to the 2nd issue of my DevOps Industry Updates newsletter. While there is a lot of turbulence in our world right now, one thing that I think will continue to unite us is our shared passion to build great things.

articles.title: Every Amazon Web Service described in one line
articles.author: Joshua Thijssen
articles.description: there are 163 different Amazon Web Services - I tried to capture what the service does in a single one-liner to give you a global overview.

articles.title: How VC works - A Beginner's Guide
articles.author: Vivek Raju
articles.description: a high-level overview of how the world of venture capital works.

articles.title: Thai Database Leaks 8.3 Billion Internet Records
articles.author: xxdesmus
articles.description: I recently discovered an exposed ElasticSearch database when browsing BinaryEdge and Shodan. This database appears to be owned by Thailand-based mobile network operator Advanced Info Service (AIS).

articles.title: SHA-1 is a Shambles
articles.author: Ga√´tan Leurent & Thomas Peyrin
articles.description: We have computed the very first chosen-prefix collision for SHA-1. In a nutshell, this means a complete and practical break of the SHA-1 hash function, with dangerous practical implications if you are still using this hash function.

articles.title: OpenSSH 8.3 released
articles.description: future deprecation notice - it is now possible to perform chosen-prefix attacks against the SHA-1 algorithm for less than USD$50K. For this reason, we will be disabling the "ssh-rsa" public key signature algorithm by default in a near-future release.

articles.title: How we reduced the AWS costs of our streaming data pipeline by 67%
articles.author: Taloflow
articles.description: this post illustrates how a little bit of diligence and a clear cost objective can end up making a large impact on profitability.

articles.title: The PEPs of Python 3.9
articles.description: Python 3.9 is now feature-complete. The release announcement lists a half-dozen Python Enhancement Proposals (PEPs) that were accepted, including those for string manipulations a new parser and more.

articles.title: Language Models are Few-Shot Learners
articles.author: Cornell University
articles.description: Recent work has demonstrated substantial gains on many NLP tasks and benchmarks by pre-training on a large corpus of text followed by fine-tuning on a specific task.

articles.title: An Introduction to Apache Airflow
articles.author: Bhavani Ravi
articles.description: Airflow is a platform created by the community to programmatically author, schedule, and monitor workflows.

articles.title: Why is Kubernetes getting so popular?
articles.author: Ricardo Aravena
articles.description: at the time of this article, Kubernetes is about six years old, and over the last two years, it has risen in popularity to consistently be one of the most loved platforms.

articles.title: Zero-day in Sign in with Apple
articles.author: Amol Baikar
articles.description: what if I say, your Email ID is all I need to takeover your account on your favorite website or an app. Sounds scary, right? This is what a bug in Sign in with Apple allowed me to do.

articles.title: (Very) Basic Intro To Elliptic Curve Cryptography
articles.author: Lane Wagner
articles.description: a basic introduction to elliptic curve cryptography. Assumes audience is trying to gain an understanding of why ECC is an effective cryptographic tool and the basics of why it works.

articles.title: How to Beat the Internet Latency?
articles.author: Alen Zubic
articles.description: We conducted network latency tests among a large number of virtual machines provisioned around the globe. Multiple cloud providers were used. Results show that by smart routing, we may be able to build fast networks‚Äîmaybe faster then the internet as we know it.

articles.title: Reconstructing a lost NES game from 30-year-old source code disks
articles.author: Rich Whitehouse
articles.description: how we recovered and re-assembled Days of Thunder, an unreleased, never-before-seen title co-authored by Chris Oberth at Mindscape.

articles.title: areebbeigh/codeinterview-backend
articles.author: Areeb Beigh
articles.description: CodeInterview is a home made solution and personal self-learning project for online coding interviews.

articles.title: NSA Exposes Tool Used By Russian Hackers
articles.author: William Turton
articles.description: the National Security Agency publicly accused infamous Russian hacking group Sandworm of exploiting a flaw in software commonly found in Linux called "Exim".

articles.title: New Air Force B-21 stealth bomber runs Kubernetes
articles.author: Independent Eagle
articles.description: by drawing upon software-enabled virtualization, systems can upgrade faster, reduce their hardware footprint and better employ automation, AI and machine-learning applications.

articles.title: New ASN created for SpaceX Starlink
articles.description: assigned the ASN number of 14593, the combination of low latency (20-40ms) and high bandwidth (100+Mbps) has never been available in satellite internet before.

articles.title: The beauty of Unix pipelines
articles.author: Prithu Goswami
articles.description: in this post I would like to show some examples of how one can use different unix tools together to accomplish something powerful.

articles.title: Log Monitoring and Alerting with Grafana Loki
articles.author: Ruturaj Kadikar
articles.description: provides an insight into the architectural differences of the Promtail, Loki, and, Grafana (PLG) stack compared to other logging and monitoring stacks such as Elasticsearch-FluentD-Kibana (EFK).

articles.title: Two Critical Flaws in Zoom Could've Let Attackers Hack Systems via Chat
articles.author: Mohit Kumar
articles.description: the first security vulnerability (CVE-2020-6109) resided in the way Zoom leverages GIPHY service to let its users search and exchange animated GIFs while chatting and the second remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2020-6110) resided in the way vulnerable versions of the Zoom application process code snippets shared through the chat.

articles.title: NetApp to Acquire Spot.io
articles.description: NetApp today announced it has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Spot, a leader in compute management and cost optimization on the public clouds, to help it establish leadership in Application Driven Infrastructure.

articles.title: Slack and AWS join forces to drive agility in software development
articles.author: Slack Blog
articles.description: Slack will draw on the underlying tech for Chime video-calling service to deliver better video calls for millions of Slack users, employees of Amazon will be able to use Slack.

articles.title: Amazon EC2 C5a Instances Powered By 2nd Gen AMD EPYC Processors
articles.author: Channy Yun
articles.description: C5a instances are variants of Amazon EC2‚Äôs compute-optimized (C5) instance family and provide high performance processing at 10% lower cost over comparable instances. C5a instances are ideal for a broad set of compute-intensive workloads including batch processing, distributed analytics, data transformations, log analysis, and web applications.

articles.title: How Cloudflare uses HashiCorp Nomad
articles.author: Thomas Lefebvre
articles.description: in this blog post, we will walk you through the reliability model of services running in our more than 200 edge cities worldwide, including how deploying Nomad helped us improve the availability of services in each of those data centers.

articles.title: EnergizedProtection/block
articles.author: Nayem Ador
articles.description: consolidates several reputable filters, and merges them into couple of protection packs with duplicates and dead/inactive domains removed. A variety of tailored packs are provided.

articles.title: django-postgres-vue-gitlab-ecs
articles.author: Brian Caffey
articles.description: an example project that demonstrates local development, CI/CD and production setup for a full stack web app using Django, Django REST Framework, Django Channels, Postgres, VueJS, Redis, Celery, GitLab CI and AWS technologies deployed with CDK.

articles.title: The Impending Doom of Expiring Root CAs and Legacy Clients
articles.author: Scott Helme
articles.description: over the last year or so I've been watching as a potentially big problem has been rolling in over the horizon and just the other day I saw the first signs of the storm hitting the shore.

articles.title: Container technologies at Coinbase: why Kubernetes is not part of our stack
articles.author: Drew Rothstein
articles.description: container orchestration platforms are complex and amazing technologies, helping some businesses and teams solve a whole suite of problems. What‚Äôs commonly overlooked however, is that container technologies also create a large set of challenges that must be overcome to prevent failures.

articles.title: Should You Run Stateful Systems via Container Orchestration?
articles.author: Erik Osterman
articles.description: as with any tool, it's the operator's responsibility to know how to operate it. There are a lot of ways to blow one's leg off using Kubernetes.

articles.title: Priyanka Sharma takes over the leadership of the CNCF
articles.author: Frederic Lardinois
articles.description: the Cloud Native Computing Foundation, the Linux Foundation-based home of open-source projects like Kubernetes, OpenTracing and Envoy, today announced that Dan Kohn, the long-time executive director of the organization, is stepping down, with Priyanka Sharma, the director of Cloud Native Alliances at GitLab, stepping into the general manager role.

articles.title: Container Sprawl Is the New VM Sprawl
articles.author: Tobi Knaup
articles.description: as organizations continue to scale and shift their operations to a hybrid mix of on-prem, cloud, and edge infrastructure, the rapid deployment of Kubernetes clusters and workloads is creating a new challenge.

articles.title: Why I'm enjoying learning Rust as a Java programmer
articles.author: Mike Bursell
articles.description: here are some of my thoughts on Rust, from the point of view of a Java developer with a strong object-oriented background.

articles.title: To Rust or not to Rust?
articles.author: Liborty Rustafarian
articles.description: tldr: there is no need to be afraid of Rust. When you are prepared to put some effort and application into it, it will repay you handsomely with safety and performance.

articles.title: Introducing App Service Static Web Apps
articles.author: Daria Grigoriu
articles.description: with Static Web Apps, developers can use modular and extensible patterns to deploy apps in minutes while taking advantage of the built-in scaling and cost-savings offered by serverless technologies.

articles.title: Supporting the Evolving Ingress Specification in Kubernetes 1.18
articles.author: Alex Gervais
articles.description: in this blog post, we‚Äôll walk through what‚Äôs new in the new Ingress specification, what it means for your applications, and how to upgrade to an ingress controller that supports this new specification.

articles.title: 5 Questions That (Newly) Virtual Leaders Should Ask Themselves
articles.author: Melissa Raffoni
articles.description: Melissa Raffoni, an executive coach shares five questions to ask yourself to ensure you are being the best leader you can be as you manage your team from home.

articles.title: DigitalOcean Raises $50M At $1.15B Valuation
articles.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
articles.description: DigitalOcean, which describes itself as ‚Äúthe cloud for developing modern apps,‚Äù announced today that it has raised a $50 million Series C at a valuation of $1.15 billion.

articles.title: Introducing the Amazon EKS Best Practices Guide for Security
articles.description: Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) now makes it easier to implement security best practices for Kubernetes on AWS with the [Amazon EKS Best Practices Guide for Security](https://aws.github.io/aws-eks-best-practices/){:target="_blank"}.

articles.title: Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes
articles.author: Jeremy Winter
articles.description: Azure Arc is a set of technologies that unlocks new hybrid scenarios for customers by bringing Azure services and management to any infrastructure across datacenters, edge, and multi-cloud.

articles.title: Amazon MSK now supports Apache Kafka version upgrades
articles.description: in a few clicks you can take advantage of new Apache Kafka features and bug fixes by upgrading the version of Apache Kafka deployed on new and existing Amazon Managed Streaming for Apache Kafka (Amazon MSK) clusters.

articles.title: The Amazon S3 challenge
articles.author: Vasily Pantyukhin
articles.description: through a series of levels, you'll learn some of the Amazon S3 features.

articles.title: Single Sign-On between Okta Universal Directory and AWS
articles.author: S√©bastien Stormacq
articles.description: how to enable automatic user synchronization between Okta and AWS, allowing users to sign in to AWS environments using the flow they are already familiar with in Okta.

articles.title: Deploy Any Resource With The New Kubernetes Provider for Terraform
articles.description: lets you package, deploy, and manage all Kubernetes resources, including Custom Resource Definitions, using HashiCorp Configuration Language (HCL).

articles.title: Swifter Than DynamoDB: Lambda Store - Serverless Redis
articles.author: Mattia Bianchi
articles.description: as a Serverless Redis service, Lambda Store is an alternative to both DynamoDB and ElastiCache. In this post, I'll focus on one of the cases that you should use/pick Lambda Store instead of DynamoDB.

articles.title: Weird ‚ÄúSubdomain Take Over‚Äù pattern of Amazon S3
articles.author: Simgamsetti Manikanta
articles.description: in this write-up, I will show the non-typical way of S3 subdomain takeover and also show the OSINT process to find the s3 regions and finally how I found the correct region of the target.

articles.title: Real-time anomaly detection support in Amazon Elasticsearch Service
articles.description: Amazon Elasticsearch Service now offers anomaly detection, which uses machine learning to detect anomalies on real-time streaming data and identifies issues as they evolve so you can mitigate them immediately.

articles.title: Tighten S3 permissions for your IAM users and roles using access history of S3 actions
articles.description: to help you identify unused S3 permissions, IAM extended service last accessed information will include S3 management actions and the last time a user or role used an S3 action.

articles.title: SpotCost
articles.author: Victor
articles.description: this tool simplifies the comparison of AWS spot instances on a one-page view. Compare Pricing, interruption rate, specifications, locations, pricing in time, and between regions.

articles.title: Introducing cross-region replica for Cloud SQL
articles.author: Nimesh Bhagat
articles.description: we are excited to launch Cloud SQL cross-region replication, which is now available for MySQL and PostgreSQL database engines.
